p.s: Opitutaceae (O.pi.tu.ta′ce.ae. N.L. masc. n. Opitutus type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Opitutaceae the family of the genus Opitutus).
Encompasses Gram-negative bacteria retrieved mainly from soil and terrestrial environments, including a hot spring and wood, within the order Opitutales.
Currently, the family comprises the genera Opitutus and Alterococcus, together with several uncultured bacteria retrieved mainly from soil environments.
Delineation of the family is determined primarily by phylogenetic information from 16S rRNA gene sequences.
Gram-negative, motile, facultatively or obligately anaerobic cocci.
The DNA G+C content of members of the family is 65–74 mol%.
The type genus is the genus Opitutus (Chin et al., 2001).
